intro: Adinandra rubropunctata, commonly known as the red-spotted adenium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red-brown bark and swollen, bottle-shaped trunk. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops or in dry woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
